column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)

column6: Interactions with water as a shared resource
column7: Pro Medicus recognises the importance of promoting sustainable water management practices. Water scarcity is increasingly affecting more populations worldwide. Pro Medicus monitors and reports water consumption, intending to reduce our environmental impact and increase efficient water management practices.

column6: Operational sites owned, leased, managed in, or adjacent to, protected areas and areas of high biodiversity value outside protected areas
Significant impacts of activities, produces, and services on biodiversity
IUCN Red List species and national conversation list species with habitats in areas affected by operations

column13: Determine our current greenhouse gas emissions by conducting a comprehensive carbon footprint assessment, considering emissions from energy consumption, transportation, waste generation, and those within the Group's supply chain.
We establish achievable reduction targets for our Company's emissions. We aim to reduce emissions through energy efficiency measures, renewable energy adoption, and process optimisation.

Being carbon neutral is an ongoing process, and we will continually evaluate and adjust our choices of emissions to minimise our environmental impact. Regularly track and report the Group's progress towards carbon neutrality.
column20: Carbon Neutral, Emission Minimisation, Environmental Impact

column13: The GHG emissions have been prepared by Pro Medicus's GHG Inventory Basis of Preparation, which references the World Business Council for Sustainable Development Greenhouse Gas Protocol. The methodology for energy and emission factors related to the international offices is sourced from Australia's National Greenhouse Accounts (NGA), the German Environmental Federal Office and the US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).

column6: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column7: Develop strategies to minimise waste generation and maximise recycling within the Company.

column6: Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
column7: The Group has no significant identified risks about environmental regulations currently in force. There have been no known breaches of any rules by the Group.

column6: New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
column7: We trade only with recognised, reputable and credit-worthy third parties and have long-standing relationships with our suppliers that last several years or more. We currently do not have any joint venture arrangements and have minimal change in our supplier list from year to year, domestically and in our overseas subsidiaries.

column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: Our people are our most important asset, and the engagement survey lets us hear from them and identify areas to improve in future.

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: Our succession planning framework helps us identify and develop talent who can move into leadership roles when they become vacant. It will ensure the Company maintains its productivity and thrives as leadership changes.\t

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: Employees who feel valued and supported are likelier to remain loyal to the Company. Reducing turnover saves recruitment and training costs and fosters continuity, stability, and institutional knowledge, contributing to sustainability.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees

column7: Annual leave, sick leave, and Long service leave

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
column7: The Group may terminate the Executive's employment agreement by providing three months' written notice or payment instead of the notice period (based on the fixed component of the Executive's remuneration). The Group may terminate the contract without notice if serious misconduct has occurred.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column7: The Committee's primary risk management responsibility is to monitor and review the Company's risk management framework at least annually to assess whether it is sound and is operating by the nature and extent of the acceptable levels of risk determined by the Board and report to the Board on the results of those assessments.

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
Worker training on occupational health and safety
